rComments: She knew exactly how much content to pack into each lecture without wasting time. Writes all of her notes on the chalkboard, so you won't find her notes online. Tests aren't that bad if you practice for them. Homework and labs are long, especially Lab 7; it's a killer.

2 midterms and a final, questions aren't much harder than the homework questions are. She's the best; the textbooks are free online (like actually free, no piracy), and is very clear when it comes to explaining the material. Has a very good time-split between the theory and concrete examples. A very sweet and helpful professor.

She was by far one of the most helpful and very clear instructors I have had so far. The homework are pretty tough near the last 4 weeks of the quarter. She is very good with the examples in class, and always answers questions well. She makes little subtle jokes... sometimes they are funny...

Martine is a wonderful human being, and in terms of accessibility to the material learned, probably the best professor I've had in this regard. However, her grading was very very brutal, and the problem sets were tough. First midterm, and final were very hard, but the 2nd midterm was easy. Curves, but unsure to what extent. MSI recommended.

Martine, personally, was a great professor. Discrete Math is a tough subject, but she made it much easier to learn with her clear lectures. She is very energetic, surprisingly, and is easy on the ears. Martine's lectures established a new concept and then provided many examples to really. She was also able to answer any question with clarity.

The labs are tough and take time but I didn't have to pull any all nighters nor stress out last minute  like all the rumors I've heard. Start early and pace yourself and you will stay on the train and finish early. Exams are directly linked to homework and lectures.

Martine is a great teacher. I never had an engineering teacher who taught with clear lectures. I understood what she was presenting. The labs take time but they are doable. Start lab 7 early and you'll finish early. The labs were so fun and the tests are similar to the practice. If you understand the material, you'll pass with a good grade.

Start the homework as soon as it is assigned most of them will take a while. You will not finish if you start it the night before. The labs can be brutal. Do not trust in the curve, sometimes she curves down. Fun class though.

Exceptional lecture. Very fair/reasonable exams though I ran out of time on 2/3 of them. Note that if you don't finish any lab you can't pass the class for some reason. I highly recommend this class, it's nothing like ce12.
Favorite class I've ever taken

Love Martine Schlag, she makes the class easy and fun to learn. Go to MSI they help you A LOT with the hwk. Go to office hours for hwk problems you don't know, it's worth a ton on your grade. And for the tests, they are sometimes tricky but study the review and you should be guaranteed a good grade.

A wonderful teacher and human being. She has reasonable expectations for students, is super willing and beyond able to help, not to mention a quirky sense of humor. She makes it clear what she expects from students on exams and constructs informative, fun labs. Watch out for lab 7, though, it is no joke.

Oh my goodness! She is like the fairy god mother to all CE students! She even comes into the lab herlesf to help students on lab assignments. She is super smart. Also, in additioin, she hadles much of the undergraduate affairs, so getting to know her is much for your advantage!

Martine was a very passionate teacher. She is not bad by any means but the stuff she teaches is not the easiest to understand. The use of the textbook is low. Make sure you study a lot. She lets you use a cheatsheet for ALL exams/quizes

she's got a really boring sense of humor and laughs at her own jokes in front of everyone. it makes everyone feel really uncomfortable, except for the overachiever with the stretched ears. she's got some good bits of wisdom you'll only get if you go to class. homework, tests, etc. all were fair. she's just a weird person who i can't connect with.

Yes, her class is hard, but she is VERY smart and passionate about the subject. She did lose me at times but the material is abstract and there isn't a bunch of formulas people can just memorize without knowing the meaning. She has a lot of fun teaching even if most of the students are having a hard time staying awake. Just go to class and section.

I was lost for most of this class. It's probably because the material itself is pretty hard; make sure to go to MSI and section; I received my first (and only) 10 on the weekly quizzes after attending MSI my first (and only) time. Martine teaches okay, but the subject itself is pretty hard.

Martine is an awesome teacher, one of the best at UCSC. Her lectures were perfectly clear, to the point where I never opened the book. Her tests are very fair. Her class is very closely in sync with the labs. Be sure to do the homeworks and labs in this class, if you do both of those things and understand you will get an A. Take 100 with Martine.

This is so far the easiest CE professor that I had in upper divisions. I deeply regret that I didn't take seriously on the homework and labs. I practically only show up to the labs 2hrs/week max and spend less than 1 hr on each hw. Labs and homework add together is 45%!! You should never fail this class ever. (if you do, you should quit the major)

I learned alot in her class. Labs are hard but keep at it. I made the mistake of not turning in all my homework. I would have got a B but got a C because of it, so do your homework! She is very helpful, so go to her office hour. Ask as many questions as you need, and she will answer. I wish I could take her again.

Her lectures are very good and make you go, "I get it" but the book sucks so get ready from going to great explanation to crappy one. I like this subject and the labs were pretty cool and easy.  Her homework catches you a little off guard cause the book's porblems are too easy
